description:
The erection of a 7-storey and basement building for B1
Business Use within the Town and Country Planning Use
Classes Order 1987
as illustrated in drawing numbers 1857/TP00  TP01
TP02A  TP03  TP04  TP05  TP06  TP07  TP08  TP09  TP10A
TP11A  TP12 & TP13  revised by letters dated 12th
September 1988 and 28th September 1988.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and entrance ramps and facing
    materials to be used on the building shall not be otherwise
    than shall have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council before any work on site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit. A method statement detailing
    precautions to prevent noise and air pollutions likely to
    result from works of demolition and construction shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council prior to the
    commencement of works.

Condition : 3 - Details of external rooftop plant shall be submitted to and
    approved by the Council before any work is undertaken on
    this part of the development.

Condition : 4 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of occupiers and users of the remainder
    of the building and no more than 4 vehicles shall be parked
    within the curtilage of the site at anytime.

Condition : 5 - No developemnt shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 6 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 7 - & 03. To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises
    and the area generally.

Condition : 8 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 9 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 10 - Your attention is drawn to the requirements of Sections 4,
    7, and 8A of the Chronically Sick & Disabled Persons Act
    1970 that this development (for employment use or to which
    the public will be admitted) should be made accessible to
    disabled people wherever practicable. Guidance is provided
    in British Standards Institution Code of Practice BS 5588
    1987 "Access for the Disabled to Buildings".

Condition : 11 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under The Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Planning, Transport &
    Health Service, Pollution Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street
    entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 071-278 4444), or to
    seek prior approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any
    difficulty in carrying out construction other than within
    normal working hours and by means that would minimise
    disturbance to adjoining premises.

Condition : 12 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.
